alert.note: Alert for Clay; Dickinson; Geary; Jackson; Pottawatomie; Riley; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 07 at 11:28PM CDT until June 08 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Dickinson County in central Kansas... Central Geary County in east central Kansas... Southern Riley County in northeastern Kansas... Northwestern Shawnee County in east central Kansas... Central Wabaunsee County in east central Kansas... Southern Pottawatomie County in northeastern Kansas... Southwestern Jackson County in northeastern Kansas... Southeastern Clay County in north central Kansas... * Until midnight CDT. * At 1127 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Westmoreland to 5 miles southwest of Milford Lake, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Manhattan, Junction City, Wamego, Alma, Westmoreland, St. Marys, Ogden, Grandview Plaza, St. George, Milford, McFarland, Paxico, Belvue, Emmett, Louisville, Delia, Potawatomi Reservation, Milford Lake, Keats and Tuttle Creek Lake. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 297 and 338. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Dickinson; Geary; Jackson; Pottawatomie; Riley; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
